text: Harriet Smith 's intimacy at Hartfield was soon a settled thing .
text_tokenized: Harriet Smith 's intimacy at Hartfield was soon a settled thing .

text: Quick and decided in her ways , Emma lost no time in inviting , encouraging , and telling her to come very often ; and as their acquaintance increased , so did their satisfaction in each other .
text_tokenized: Quick and decided in her ways , Emma lost no time in inviting , encouraging , and telling her to come very often ; and as their acquaintance increased , so did their satisfaction in each other .

text: As a walking companion , Emma had very early foreseen how useful she might find her .
text_tokenized: As a walking companion , Emma had very early foreseen how useful she might find her .

text: In that respect Mrs. Weston 's loss had been important .
text_tokenized: In that respect Mrs. Weston 's loss had been important .

text: Her father never went beyond the shrubbery , where two divisions of the ground sufficed him for his long walk , or his short , as the year varied ; and since Mrs. Weston 's marriage her exercise had been too much confined .
text_tokenized: Her father never went beyond the shrubbery , where two divisions of the ground sufficed him for his long walk , or his short , as the year varied ; and since Mrs. Weston 's marriage her exercise had been too much confined .

text: She had ventured once alone to Randalls , but it was not pleasant ; and a Harriet Smith , therefore , one whom she could summon at any time to a walk , would be a valuable addition to her privileges .
text_tokenized: She had ventured once alone to Randalls , but it was not pleasant ; and a Harriet Smith , therefore , one whom she could summon at any time to a walk , would be a valuable addition to her privileges .

text: But in every respect , as she saw more of her , she approved her , and was confirmed in all her kind designs .
text_tokenized: But in every respect , as she saw more of her , she approved her , and was confirmed in all her kind designs .

text: Harriet certainly was not clever , but she had a sweet , docile , grateful disposition , was totally free from conceit , and only desiring to be guided by any one she looked up to . Her
text_tokenized: Harriet certainly was not clever , but she had a sweet , docile , grateful disposition , was totally free from conceit , and only desiring to be guided by any one she looked up to . Her

text: attachment to herself was very amiable ; and her inclination for good company , and power of appreciating what was elegant and clever , shewed that there was no want of taste , though strength of understanding must not be expected .
text_tokenized: attachment to herself was very amiable ; and her inclination for good company , and power of appreciating what was elegant and clever , shewed that there was no want of taste , though strength of understanding must not be expected .

text: Altogether she was quite convinced of Harriet Smith 's being exactly the young friend she wanted -- exactly the something which her home required .
text_tokenized: Altogether she was quite convinced of Harriet Smith 's being exactly the young friend she wanted -- exactly the something which her home required .

text: Such a friend as Mrs. Weston
text_tokenized: Such a friend as Mrs. Weston

text: was out of the question .

text: Two such could never be granted .
text_tokenized: Two such could never be granted .

text: Two such she did not want .
text_tokenized: Two such she did not want .

text: It was quite a different sort of thing , a sentiment distinct and independent .
text_tokenized: It was quite a different sort of thing , a sentiment distinct and independent .

text: Mrs. Weston was the object of a regard which had its basis in gratitude and esteem . Harriet would be loved as one to whom she could be useful .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Weston was the object of a regard which had its basis in gratitude and esteem . Harriet would be loved as one to whom she could be useful .

text: For Mrs. Weston there was nothing to be done ; for Harriet every thing .
text_tokenized: For Mrs. Weston there was nothing to be done ; for Harriet every thing .

text: Her first attempts at usefulness were in an endeavour to find out who were the parents , but Harriet could not tell .
text_tokenized: Her first attempts at usefulness were in an endeavour to find out who were the parents , but Harriet could not tell .

text: She was ready to tell every thing in her power , but on this subject questions were vain .
text_tokenized: She was ready to tell every thing in her power , but on this subject questions were vain .

text: Emma was obliged to fancy what she liked -- but she could never believe that in the same situation _ she _ should not have discovered the truth .
text_tokenized: Emma was obliged to fancy what she liked -- but she could never believe that in the same situation _ she _ should not have discovered the truth .

text: Harriet had no penetration .
text_tokenized: Harriet had no penetration .

text: She had been satisfied to hear and believe just what Mrs. Goddard chose to tell her ; and looked no farther .
text_tokenized: She had been satisfied to hear and believe just what Mrs. Goddard chose to tell her ; and looked no farther .

text: Mrs. Goddard , and the teachers , and the girls and the affairs of the school in general , formed naturally a great part of the conversation -- and but for her acquaintance with the Martins of Abbey - Mill Farm , it must have been the whole .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Goddard , and the teachers , and the girls and the affairs of the school in general , formed naturally a great part of the conversation -- and but for her acquaintance with the Martins of Abbey - Mill Farm , it must have been the whole .

text: But the Martins occupied her thoughts a good deal ; she had spent two very happy months with them , and now loved to talk of the pleasures of her visit , and describe the many comforts and wonders of the place .
text_tokenized: But the Martins occupied her thoughts a good deal ; she had spent two very happy months with them , and now loved to talk of the pleasures of her visit , and describe the many comforts and wonders of the place .

text: Emma encouraged her talkativeness -- amused by such a picture of another set of beings , and enjoying the youthful simplicity which could speak with so much exultation of Mrs. Martin 's having " _ two _ parlours , two very good parlours , indeed ; one of them quite as large as Mrs. Goddard 's drawing - room ; and of her having an upper maid who had lived five - and - twenty years with her ; and of their having eight cows , two of them Alderneys , and one a little Welch cow , a very pretty little Welch cow indeed ; and of Mrs. Martin 's saying as she was so fond of it , it should be called _ her _ cow ; and of their having a very handsome summer - house in their garden , where some day next year they were all to drink tea:--a very handsome summer - house , large enough to hold a dozen people . "
text_tokenized: Emma encouraged her talkativeness -- amused by such a picture of another set of beings , and enjoying the youthful simplicity which could speak with so much exultation of Mrs. Martin 's having " _ two _ parlours , two very good parlours , indeed ; one of them quite as large as Mrs. Goddard 's drawing - room ; and of her having an upper maid who had lived five - and - twenty years with her ; and of their having eight cows , two of them Alderneys , and one a little Welch cow , a very pretty little Welch cow indeed ; and of Mrs. Martin 's saying as she was so fond of it , it should be called _ her _ cow ; and of their having a very handsome summer - house in their garden , where some day next year they were all to drink tea:--a very handsome summer - house , large enough to hold a dozen people . "

text: For some time she was amused , without thinking beyond the immediate cause ; but as she came to understand the family better , other feelings arose .
text_tokenized: For some time she was amused , without thinking beyond the immediate cause ; but as she came to understand the family better , other feelings arose .

text: She had taken up a wrong idea , fancying it was a mother and daughter , a son and son 's wife , who all lived together ; but when it appeared that the Mr. Martin , who bore a part in the narrative , and was always mentioned with approbation for his great good - nature in doing something or other , was a single man ; that there was no young Mrs. Martin , no wife in the case ; she did suspect danger to her poor little friend from all this hospitality and kindness , and that , if she were not taken care of , she might be required to sink herself forever . With this inspiriting notion , her questions increased in number and meaning ; and she particularly led Harriet to talk more of Mr. Martin , and there was evidently no dislike to it .
text_tokenized: She had taken up a wrong idea , fancying it was a mother and daughter , a son and son 's wife , who all lived together ; but when it appeared that the Mr. Martin , who bore a part in the narrative , and was always mentioned with approbation for his great good - nature in doing something or other , was a single man ; that there was no young Mrs. Martin , no wife in the case ; she did suspect danger to her poor little friend from all this hospitality and kindness , and that , if she were not taken care of , she might be required to sink herself forever . With this inspiriting notion , her questions increased in number and meaning ; and she particularly led Harriet to talk more of Mr. Martin , and there was evidently no dislike to it .

text: Harriet was very ready to speak of the share he had had in their moonlight walks and merry evening games ; and dwelt a good deal upon his being so very good - humoured and obliging .
text_tokenized: Harriet was very ready to speak of the share he had had in their moonlight walks and merry evening games ; and dwelt a good deal upon his being so very good - humoured and obliging .

text: He had gone three miles round one day in order to bring her some walnuts , because she had said how fond she was of them , and in every thing else he was so very obliging .
text_tokenized: He had gone three miles round one day in order to bring her some walnuts , because she had said how fond she was of them , and in every thing else he was so very obliging .

text: He had his shepherd 's son into the parlour one night on purpose to sing to her .
text_tokenized: He had his shepherd 's son into the parlour one night on purpose to sing to her .

text: She was very fond of singing .
text_tokenized: She was very fond of singing .

text: He could sing a little himself . She believed he was very clever , and understood every thing .
text_tokenized: He could sing a little himself . She believed he was very clever , and understood every thing .

text: He had a very fine flock , and , while she was with them , he had been bid more for his wool than any body in the country . She believed every body spoke well of him .
text_tokenized: He had a very fine flock , and , while she was with them , he had been bid more for his wool than any body in the country . She believed every body spoke well of him .

text: His mother and sisters were very fond of him .
text_tokenized: His mother and sisters were very fond of him .

text: Mrs. Martin had told her one day ( and there was a blush as she said it , ) that it was impossible for any body to be a better son , and therefore she was sure , whenever he married , he would make a good husband .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Martin had told her one day ( and there was a blush as she said it , ) that it was impossible for any body to be a better son , and therefore she was sure , whenever he married , he would make a good husband .

text: Not that she _ wanted _ him to marry .
text_tokenized: Not that she _ wanted _ him to marry .

text: She was in no hurry at all .
text_tokenized: She was in no hurry at all .

text: " Well done , Mrs. Martin ! " thought Emma .
text_tokenized: " Well done , Mrs. Martin ! " thought Emma .

text: " You know what you are about . " " And when she had come away , Mrs. Martin was so very kind as to send Mrs. Goddard a beautiful goose -- the finest goose Mrs. Goddard had ever seen . Mrs. Goddard had dressed it on a Sunday , and asked all the three teachers , Miss Nash , and Miss Prince , and Miss Richardson , to sup with her . " "
text_tokenized: " You know what you are about . " " And when she had come away , Mrs. Martin was so very kind as to send Mrs. Goddard a beautiful goose -- the finest goose Mrs. Goddard had ever seen . Mrs. Goddard had dressed it on a Sunday , and asked all the three teachers , Miss Nash , and Miss Prince , and Miss Richardson , to sup with her . " "

text: Mr. Martin , I suppose , is not a man of information beyond the line of his own business ?
text_tokenized: Mr. Martin , I suppose , is not a man of information beyond the line of his own business ?

text: He does not read ?
text_tokenized: He does not read ?

text: " Oh yes!--that is , no -- I do not know -- but I believe he has read a good deal -- but not what you would think any thing of .
text_tokenized: " Oh yes!--that is , no -- I do not know -- but I believe he has read a good deal -- but not what you would think any thing of .

text: He reads the Agricultural Reports , and some other books that lay in one of the window seats -- but he reads all _ them _ to himself .
text_tokenized: He reads the Agricultural Reports , and some other books that lay in one of the window seats -- but he reads all _ them _ to himself .

text: But sometimes of an evening , before we went to cards , he would read something aloud out of the Elegant Extracts , very entertaining .
text_tokenized: But sometimes of an evening , before we went to cards , he would read something aloud out of the Elegant Extracts , very entertaining .

text: And I know he has read the Vicar of Wakefield .
text_tokenized: And I know he has read the Vicar of Wakefield .

text: He never read the Romance of the Forest , nor The Children of the Abbey .
text_tokenized: He never read the Romance of the Forest , nor The Children of the Abbey .

text: He had never heard of such books before I mentioned them , but he is determined to get them now as soon as ever he can .
text_tokenized: He had never heard of such books before I mentioned them , but he is determined to get them now as soon as ever he can .

text: " The next question was-- " What sort of looking man is Mr. Martin ? "
text_tokenized: " The next question was-- " What sort of looking man is Mr. Martin ? "

text: " Oh !
text_tokenized: " Oh !

text: not handsome -- not at all handsome .
text_tokenized: not handsome -- not at all handsome .

text: I thought him very plain at first , but I do not think him so plain now .
text_tokenized: I thought him very plain at first , but I do not think him so plain now .

text: One does not , you know , after a time .
text_tokenized: One does not , you know , after a time .

text: But did you never see him ?
text_tokenized: But did you never see him ?

text: He is in Highbury every now and then , and he is sure to ride through every week in his way to Kingston .
text_tokenized: He is in Highbury every now and then , and he is sure to ride through every week in his way to Kingston .

text: He has passed you very often .
text_tokenized: He has passed you very often .

text: " " That may be , and I may have seen him fifty times , but without having any idea of his name .
text_tokenized: " " That may be , and I may have seen him fifty times , but without having any idea of his name .

text: A young farmer , whether on horseback or on foot , is the very last sort of person to raise my curiosity .
text_tokenized: A young farmer , whether on horseback or on foot , is the very last sort of person to raise my curiosity .

text: The yeomanry are precisely the order of people with whom I feel I can have nothing to do .
text_tokenized: The yeomanry are precisely the order of people with whom I feel I can have nothing to do .

text: A degree or two lower , and a creditable appearance might interest me ; I might hope to be useful to their families in some way or other .
text_tokenized: A degree or two lower , and a creditable appearance might interest me ; I might hope to be useful to their families in some way or other .

text: But a farmer can need none of my help , and is , therefore , in one sense , as much above my notice as in every other he is below it .
text_tokenized: But a farmer can need none of my help , and is , therefore , in one sense , as much above my notice as in every other he is below it .

text: " " To be sure .
text_tokenized: " " To be sure .

text: Oh yes !
text_tokenized: Oh yes !

text: It is not likely you should ever have observed him ; but he knows you very well indeed -- I mean by sight .
text_tokenized: It is not likely you should ever have observed him ; but he knows you very well indeed -- I mean by sight .

text: " I have no doubt of his being a very respectable young man . I know , indeed , that he is so , and , as such , wish him well .
text_tokenized: " I have no doubt of his being a very respectable young man . I know , indeed , that he is so , and , as such , wish him well .

text: What do you imagine his age to be ?
text_tokenized: What do you imagine his age to be ?

text: " " He was four - and - twenty the 8th of last June , and my birthday is the 23rd just a fortnight and a day 's difference -- which is very odd . " " Only four - and - twenty .
text_tokenized: " " He was four - and - twenty the 8th of last June , and my birthday is the 23rd just a fortnight and a day 's difference -- which is very odd . " " Only four - and - twenty .

text: That is too young to settle .
text_tokenized: That is too young to settle .

text: His mother is perfectly right not to be in a hurry .
text_tokenized: His mother is perfectly right not to be in a hurry .

text: They seem very comfortable as they are , and if she were to take any pains to marry him , she would probably repent it .
text_tokenized: They seem very comfortable as they are , and if she were to take any pains to marry him , she would probably repent it .

text: Six years hence , if he could meet with a good sort of young woman in the same rank as his own , with a little money , it might be very desirable .
text_tokenized: Six years hence , if he could meet with a good sort of young woman in the same rank as his own , with a little money , it might be very desirable .

text: " " Six years hence !
text_tokenized: " " Six years hence !

text: Dear Miss Woodhouse , he would be thirty years old ! "
text_tokenized: Dear Miss Woodhouse , he would be thirty years old ! "

text: " Well , and that is as early as most men can afford to marry , who are not born to an independence .
text_tokenized: " Well , and that is as early as most men can afford to marry , who are not born to an independence .

text: Mr. Martin , I imagine , has his fortune entirely to make -- cannot be at all beforehand with the world . Whatever money he might come into when his father died , whatever his share of the family property , it is , I dare say , all afloat , all employed in his stock , and so forth ; and though , with diligence and good luck , he may be rich in time , it is next to impossible that he should have realised any thing yet .
text_tokenized: Mr. Martin , I imagine , has his fortune entirely to make -- cannot be at all beforehand with the world . Whatever money he might come into when his father died , whatever his share of the family property , it is , I dare say , all afloat , all employed in his stock , and so forth ; and though , with diligence and good luck , he may be rich in time , it is next to impossible that he should have realised any thing yet .

text: " " To be sure , so it is .
text_tokenized: " " To be sure , so it is .

text: But they live very comfortably .
text_tokenized: But they live very comfortably .

text: They have no indoors man , else they do not want for any thing ; and Mrs. Martin talks of taking a boy another year .
text_tokenized: They have no indoors man , else they do not want for any thing ; and Mrs. Martin talks of taking a boy another year .

text: " I wish you may not get into a scrape , Harriet , whenever he does marry;--I mean , as to being acquainted with his wife -- for though his sisters , from a superior education , are not to be altogether objected to , it does not follow that he might marry any body at all fit for you to notice .
text_tokenized: " I wish you may not get into a scrape , Harriet , whenever he does marry;--I mean , as to being acquainted with his wife -- for though his sisters , from a superior education , are not to be altogether objected to , it does not follow that he might marry any body at all fit for you to notice .

text: The misfortune of your birth ought to make you particularly careful as to your associates .
text_tokenized: The misfortune of your birth ought to make you particularly careful as to your associates .

text: There can be no doubt of your being a gentleman 's daughter , and you must support your claim to that station by every thing within your own power , or there will be plenty of people who would take pleasure in degrading you .
text_tokenized: There can be no doubt of your being a gentleman 's daughter , and you must support your claim to that station by every thing within your own power , or there will be plenty of people who would take pleasure in degrading you .

text: " " Yes , to be sure , I suppose there are .
text_tokenized: " " Yes , to be sure , I suppose there are .

text: But while I visit at Hartfield , and you are so kind to me , Miss Woodhouse , I am not afraid of what any body can do .
text_tokenized: But while I visit at Hartfield , and you are so kind to me , Miss Woodhouse , I am not afraid of what any body can do .

text: " " You understand the force of influence pretty well , Harriet ; but I would have you so firmly established in good society , as to be independent even of Hartfield and Miss Woodhouse .
text_tokenized: " " You understand the force of influence pretty well , Harriet ; but I would have you so firmly established in good society , as to be independent even of Hartfield and Miss Woodhouse .

text: I want to see you permanently well connected , and to that end it will be advisable to have as few odd acquaintance as may be ; and , therefore , I say that if you should still be in this country when Mr. Martin marries , I wish you may not be drawn in by your intimacy with the sisters , to be acquainted with the wife , who will probably be some mere farmer 's daughter , without education . " " To be sure .
text_tokenized: I want to see you permanently well connected , and to that end it will be advisable to have as few odd acquaintance as may be ; and , therefore , I say that if you should still be in this country when Mr. Martin marries , I wish you may not be drawn in by your intimacy with the sisters , to be acquainted with the wife , who will probably be some mere farmer 's daughter , without education . " " To be sure .

text: Yes .
text_tokenized: Yes .

text: Not that I think Mr. Martin would ever marry any body but what had had some education -- and been very well brought up .
text_tokenized: Not that I think Mr. Martin would ever marry any body but what had had some education -- and been very well brought up .

text: However , I do not mean to set up my opinion against your's -- and I am sure I shall not wish for the acquaintance of his wife .
text_tokenized: However , I do not mean to set up my opinion against your's -- and I am sure I shall not wish for the acquaintance of his wife .

text: I shall always have a great regard for the Miss Martins , especially Elizabeth , and should be very sorry to give them up , for they are quite as well educated as me . But if he marries a very ignorant , vulgar woman , certainly I had better not visit her , if I can help it . " Emma watched her through the fluctuations of this speech , and saw no alarming symptoms of love .
text_tokenized: I shall always have a great regard for the Miss Martins , especially Elizabeth , and should be very sorry to give them up , for they are quite as well educated as me . But if he marries a very ignorant , vulgar woman , certainly I had better not visit her , if I can help it . " Emma watched her through the fluctuations of this speech , and saw no alarming symptoms of love .

text: The young man had been the first admirer , but she trusted there was no other hold , and that there would be no serious difficulty , on Harriet 's side , to oppose any friendly arrangement of her own . They met Mr. Martin the very next day , as they were walking on the Donwell road .
text_tokenized: The young man had been the first admirer , but she trusted there was no other hold , and that there would be no serious difficulty , on Harriet 's side , to oppose any friendly arrangement of her own . They met Mr. Martin the very next day , as they were walking on the Donwell road .

text: He was on foot , and after looking very respectfully at her , looked with most unfeigned satisfaction at her companion .
text_tokenized: He was on foot , and after looking very respectfully at her , looked with most unfeigned satisfaction at her companion .

text: Emma was not sorry to have such an opportunity of survey ; and walking a few yards forward , while they talked together , soon made her quick eye sufficiently acquainted with Mr. Robert Martin .
text_tokenized: Emma was not sorry to have such an opportunity of survey ; and walking a few yards forward , while they talked together , soon made her quick eye sufficiently acquainted with Mr. Robert Martin .

text: His appearance was very neat , and he looked like a sensible young man , but his person had no other advantage ; and when he came to be contrasted with gentlemen , she thought he must lose all the ground he had gained in Harriet 's inclination .
text_tokenized: His appearance was very neat , and he looked like a sensible young man , but his person had no other advantage ; and when he came to be contrasted with gentlemen , she thought he must lose all the ground he had gained in Harriet 's inclination .

text: Harriet was not insensible of manner ; she had voluntarily noticed her father 's gentleness with admiration as well as wonder .
text_tokenized: Harriet was not insensible of manner ; she had voluntarily noticed her father 's gentleness with admiration as well as wonder .

text: " Only think of our happening to meet him!--How very odd !
text_tokenized: " Only think of our happening to meet him!--How very odd !

text: It was quite a chance , he said , that he had not gone round by Randalls .
text_tokenized: It was quite a chance , he said , that he had not gone round by Randalls .

text: He did not think we ever walked this road .
text_tokenized: He did not think we ever walked this road .

text: He thought we walked towards Randalls most days .
text_tokenized: He thought we walked towards Randalls most days .

text: He has not been able to get the Romance of the Forest yet .
text_tokenized: He has not been able to get the Romance of the Forest yet .

text: He was so busy the last time he was at Kingston that he quite forgot it , but he goes again to - morrow .
text_tokenized: He was so busy the last time he was at Kingston that he quite forgot it , but he goes again to - morrow .

text: So very odd we should happen to meet !
text_tokenized: So very odd we should happen to meet !

text: Well , Miss Woodhouse , is he like what you expected ?
text_tokenized: Well , Miss Woodhouse , is he like what you expected ?

text: What do you think of him ?
text_tokenized: What do you think of him ?

text: Do you think him so very plain ?
text_tokenized: Do you think him so very plain ?

text: " " He is very plain , undoubtedly -- remarkably plain:--but that is nothing compared with his entire want of gentility .
text_tokenized: " " He is very plain , undoubtedly -- remarkably plain:--but that is nothing compared with his entire want of gentility .

text: I had no right to expect much , and I did not expect much ; but I had no idea that he could be so very clownish , so totally without air .
text_tokenized: I had no right to expect much , and I did not expect much ; but I had no idea that he could be so very clownish , so totally without air .

text: I had imagined him , I confess , a degree or two nearer gentility . " " To be sure , " said Harriet , in a mortified voice , " he is not so genteel as real gentlemen . " "
text_tokenized: I had imagined him , I confess , a degree or two nearer gentility . " " To be sure , " said Harriet , in a mortified voice , " he is not so genteel as real gentlemen . " "

text: I think , Harriet , since your acquaintance with us , you have been repeatedly in the company of some such very real gentlemen , that you must yourself be struck with the difference in Mr. Martin .
text_tokenized: I think , Harriet , since your acquaintance with us , you have been repeatedly in the company of some such very real gentlemen , that you must yourself be struck with the difference in Mr. Martin .

text: At Hartfield , you have had very good specimens of well educated , well bred men .
text_tokenized: At Hartfield , you have had very good specimens of well educated , well bred men .

text: I should be surprized if , after seeing them , you could be in company with Mr. Martin again without perceiving him to be a very inferior creature -- and rather wondering at yourself for having ever thought him at all agreeable before .
text_tokenized: I should be surprized if , after seeing them , you could be in company with Mr. Martin again without perceiving him to be a very inferior creature -- and rather wondering at yourself for having ever thought him at all agreeable before .

text: Do not you begin to feel that now ?
text_tokenized: Do not you begin to feel that now ?

text: Were not you struck ?
text_tokenized: Were not you struck ?

text: I am sure you must have been struck by his awkward look and abrupt manner , and the uncouthness of a voice which I heard to be wholly unmodulated as I stood here . " " Certainly , he is not like Mr. Knightley .
text_tokenized: I am sure you must have been struck by his awkward look and abrupt manner , and the uncouthness of a voice which I heard to be wholly unmodulated as I stood here . " " Certainly , he is not like Mr. Knightley .

text: He has not such a fine air and way of walking as Mr. Knightley . I see the difference plain enough .
text_tokenized: He has not such a fine air and way of walking as Mr. Knightley . I see the difference plain enough .

text: But Mr. Knightley is so very fine a man ! " " Mr. Knightley 's air is so remarkably good that it is not fair to compare Mr. Martin with _ him _ .
text_tokenized: But Mr. Knightley is so very fine a man ! " " Mr. Knightley 's air is so remarkably good that it is not fair to compare Mr. Martin with _ him _ .

text: You might not see one in a hundred with _ gentleman _ so plainly written as in Mr. Knightley .
text_tokenized: You might not see one in a hundred with _ gentleman _ so plainly written as in Mr. Knightley .

text: But he is not the only gentleman you have been lately used to . What say you to Mr. Weston and Mr. Elton ?
text_tokenized: But he is not the only gentleman you have been lately used to . What say you to Mr. Weston and Mr. Elton ?

text: Compare Mr. Martin with either of _ them _ .
text_tokenized: Compare Mr. Martin with either of _ them _ .

text: Compare their manner of carrying themselves ; of walking ; of speaking ; of being silent .
text_tokenized: Compare their manner of carrying themselves ; of walking ; of speaking ; of being silent .

text: You must see the difference .
text_tokenized: You must see the difference .

text: " " Oh yes!--there is a great difference .
text_tokenized: " " Oh yes!--there is a great difference .

text: But Mr. Weston is almost an old man .
text_tokenized: But Mr. Weston is almost an old man .

text: Mr. Weston must be between forty and fifty . " " Which makes his good manners the more valuable .
text_tokenized: Mr. Weston must be between forty and fifty . " " Which makes his good manners the more valuable .

text: The older a person grows , Harriet , the more important it is that their manners should not be bad ; the more glaring and disgusting any loudness , or coarseness , or awkwardness becomes .
text_tokenized: The older a person grows , Harriet , the more important it is that their manners should not be bad ; the more glaring and disgusting any loudness , or coarseness , or awkwardness becomes .

text: What is passable in youth is detestable in later age .
text_tokenized: What is passable in youth is detestable in later age .

text: Mr. Martin is now awkward and abrupt ; what will he be at Mr. Weston 's time of life ?
text_tokenized: Mr. Martin is now awkward and abrupt ; what will he be at Mr. Weston 's time of life ?

text: " " There is no saying , indeed , " replied Harriet rather solemnly .
text_tokenized: " " There is no saying , indeed , " replied Harriet rather solemnly .

text: " But there may be pretty good guessing .
text_tokenized: " But there may be pretty good guessing .

text: He will be a completely gross , vulgar farmer , totally inattentive to appearances , and thinking of nothing but profit and loss . " " Will he , indeed ?
text_tokenized: He will be a completely gross , vulgar farmer , totally inattentive to appearances , and thinking of nothing but profit and loss . " " Will he , indeed ?

text: That will be very bad . "
text_tokenized: That will be very bad . "

text: " How much his business engrosses him already is very plain from the circumstance of his forgetting to inquire for the book you recommended .
text_tokenized: " How much his business engrosses him already is very plain from the circumstance of his forgetting to inquire for the book you recommended .

text: He was a great deal too full of the market to think of any thing else -- which is just as it should be , for a thriving man .
text_tokenized: He was a great deal too full of the market to think of any thing else -- which is just as it should be , for a thriving man .

text: What has he to do with books ?
text_tokenized: What has he to do with books ?

text: And I have no doubt that he _ will _ thrive , and be a very rich man in time -- and his being illiterate and coarse need not disturb _ us _ .
text_tokenized: And I have no doubt that he _ will _ thrive , and be a very rich man in time -- and his being illiterate and coarse need not disturb _ us _ .

text: " " I wonder he did not remember the book"--was all Harriet 's answer , and spoken with a degree of grave displeasure which Emma thought might be safely left to itself . She , therefore , said no more for some time .
text_tokenized: " " I wonder he did not remember the book"--was all Harriet 's answer , and spoken with a degree of grave displeasure which Emma thought might be safely left to itself . She , therefore , said no more for some time .

text: Her next beginning was , " In one respect , perhaps , Mr. Elton 's manners are superior to Mr. Knightley 's or Mr. Weston 's .
text_tokenized: Her next beginning was , " In one respect , perhaps , Mr. Elton 's manners are superior to Mr. Knightley 's or Mr. Weston 's .

text: They have more gentleness .
text_tokenized: They have more gentleness .

text: They might be more safely held up as a pattern .
text_tokenized: They might be more safely held up as a pattern .

text: There is an openness , a quickness , almost a bluntness in Mr. Weston , which every body likes in _ him _ , because there is so much good - humour with it -- but that would not do to be copied .
text_tokenized: There is an openness , a quickness , almost a bluntness in Mr. Weston , which every body likes in _ him _ , because there is so much good - humour with it -- but that would not do to be copied .

text: Neither would Mr. Knightley 's downright , decided , commanding sort of manner , though it suits _ him _ very well ; his figure , and look , and situation in life seem to allow it ; but if any young man were to set about copying him , he would not be sufferable . On the contrary , I think a young man might be very safely recommended to take Mr. Elton as a model .
text_tokenized: Neither would Mr. Knightley 's downright , decided , commanding sort of manner , though it suits _ him _ very well ; his figure , and look , and situation in life seem to allow it ; but if any young man were to set about copying him , he would not be sufferable . On the contrary , I think a young man might be very safely recommended to take Mr. Elton as a model .

text: Mr. Elton is good - humoured , cheerful , obliging , and gentle .
text_tokenized: Mr. Elton is good - humoured , cheerful , obliging , and gentle .

text: He seems to me to be grown particularly gentle of late .
text_tokenized: He seems to me to be grown particularly gentle of late .

text: I do not know whether he has any design of ingratiating himself with either of us , Harriet , by additional softness , but it strikes me that his manners are softer than they used to be . If he means any thing , it must be to please you .
text_tokenized: I do not know whether he has any design of ingratiating himself with either of us , Harriet , by additional softness , but it strikes me that his manners are softer than they used to be . If he means any thing , it must be to please you .

text: Did not I tell you what he said of you the other day ? "
text_tokenized: Did not I tell you what he said of you the other day ? "

text: She then repeated some warm personal praise which she had drawn from Mr. Elton , and now did full justice to ; and Harriet blushed and smiled , and said she had always thought Mr. Elton very agreeable .
text_tokenized: She then repeated some warm personal praise which she had drawn from Mr. Elton , and now did full justice to ; and Harriet blushed and smiled , and said she had always thought Mr. Elton very agreeable .

text: Mr. Elton was the very person fixed on by Emma for driving the young farmer out of Harriet 's head . She thought it would be an excellent match ; and only too palpably desirable , natural , and probable , for her to have much merit in planning it . She feared it was what every body else must think of and predict .
text_tokenized: Mr. Elton was the very person fixed on by Emma for driving the young farmer out of Harriet 's head . She thought it would be an excellent match ; and only too palpably desirable , natural , and probable , for her to have much merit in planning it . She feared it was what every body else must think of and predict .

text: It was not likely , however , that any body should have equalled her in the date of the plan , as it had entered her brain during the very first evening of Harriet 's coming to Hartfield . The longer she considered it , the greater was her sense of its expediency .
text_tokenized: It was not likely , however , that any body should have equalled her in the date of the plan , as it had entered her brain during the very first evening of Harriet 's coming to Hartfield . The longer she considered it , the greater was her sense of its expediency .

text: Mr. Elton 's situation was most suitable , quite the gentleman himself , and without low connexions ; at the same time , not of any family that could fairly object to the doubtful birth of Harriet .
text_tokenized: Mr. Elton 's situation was most suitable , quite the gentleman himself , and without low connexions ; at the same time , not of any family that could fairly object to the doubtful birth of Harriet .

text: He had a comfortable home for her , and Emma imagined a very sufficient income ; for though the vicarage of Highbury was not large , he was known to have some independent property ; and she thought very highly of him as a good - humoured , well - meaning , respectable young man , without any deficiency of useful understanding or knowledge of the world .
text_tokenized: He had a comfortable home for her , and Emma imagined a very sufficient income ; for though the vicarage of Highbury was not large , he was known to have some independent property ; and she thought very highly of him as a good - humoured , well - meaning , respectable young man , without any deficiency of useful understanding or knowledge of the world .

text: She had already satisfied herself that he thought Harriet a beautiful girl , which she trusted , with such frequent meetings at Hartfield , was foundation enough on his side ; and on Harriet 's there could be little doubt that the idea of being preferred by him would have all the usual weight and efficacy .
text_tokenized: She had already satisfied herself that he thought Harriet a beautiful girl , which she trusted , with such frequent meetings at Hartfield , was foundation enough on his side ; and on Harriet 's there could be little doubt that the idea of being preferred by him would have all the usual weight and efficacy .

text: And he was really a very pleasing young man , a young man whom any woman not fastidious might like .
text_tokenized: And he was really a very pleasing young man , a young man whom any woman not fastidious might like .

text: He was reckoned very handsome ; his person much admired in general , though not by her , there being a want of elegance of feature which she could not dispense with:--but the girl who could be gratified by a Robert Martin 's riding about the country to get walnuts for her might very well be conquered by Mr. Elton 's admiration .
text_tokenized: He was reckoned very handsome ; his person much admired in general , though not by her , there being a want of elegance of feature which she could not dispense with:--but the girl who could be gratified by a Robert Martin 's riding about the country to get walnuts for her might very well be conquered by Mr. Elton 's admiration .
